title: Best Instant Pot Scalloped Potatoes Recipe
description: These quick and easy Instant Pot scalloped potatoes are rich and creamy with Cheddar cheese and spices. They're the ultimate side dish for any meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Potato Scalloped Potato Recipes Best Instant Pot Scalloped Potatoes 4.6 (71) 61 Reviews 12 Photos These Instant Pot scalloped potatoes are the ultimate side dish. They're easy to make and ready in about 30 minutes. Submitted by Fioa Updated on November 4, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 12 12 12 12 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 pounds Yukon gold or red potato, cut into 1/4-inch slices 1 cup vegetable broth ½ teaspoon salt 2 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, divided 3 tablespoons heavy cream ½ teaspoon garlic powder ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper ¼ teaspoon nutmeg Directions Combine potatoes, broth, and salt in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 1 minute. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Meanwhile, set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Carefully transfer potatoes to a deep 8-inch square baking dish. Combine 1 1/2 cups Cheddar cheese, cream, garlic powder, pepper, and nutmeg in the pressure cooker with the remaining liquid; select Sauté function and cook until smooth and creamy, about 5 minutes. Pour sauce evenly over potatoes and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese. Broil in the preheated oven until cheese is golden, about 5 minutes. I Made It Print 269 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 506 Calories 27g Fat 44g Carbs 22g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 506 % Daily Value * Total Fat 27g 35% Saturated Fat 17g 86% Cholesterol 88mg 29% Sodium 852mg 37% Total Carbohydrate 44g 16% Dietary Fiber 4g 14% Total Sugars 1g Protein 22g 45% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 511mg 39% Iron 1mg 3% Potassium 82mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Best Instant Pot Scalloped Potatoes 01 of 12 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 12 Photo by  Robert F 04/22/2024 OK with tweaks 03 of 12 Photo by  Shirley Spidle Hedge 04/06/2022 excellent flavor. I only had beef broth and Mexican cheese, but it worked out fine. I ended up having to mix the potatoes and the cheese mixture in the instant pot after sauteing the cheese mixture. I also added in some ham pieces. 04 of 12 Photo by  Dawn Gill 11/06/2021 05 of 12 Photo by  Rebecca Brown 01/07/2020 06 of 12 Photo by  Beththewinediva 06/01/2019 07 of 12 Photo by  Rick 02/19/2019 Excellent, made larger portion than recipe called for and had to adjust cooking time, but was a big hit with family. 08 of 12 Photo by  Rhonda Anderson 02/18/2019 09 of 12 Photo by  Dana Long Schmidt 02/15/2019 Added onion flakes and parsley and butter. It was delicious. 10 of 12 Photo by  Jay Braun 02/14/2019 No changes made for this time, but 5 minutes under broiler is about 2 minutes too long. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Scalloped Potatoes for the BBQ 75 Ratings Scalloped Red Potatoes 222 Ratings Scalloped Potatoes with Bacon 234 Ratings Fancy Crusted Rosemary Scalloped Potatoes 8 Ratings Gluten-Free Scalloped Potatoes 3 Ratings Easy Scalloped Potatoes 195 Ratings Baked Scalloped Potatoes 224 Ratings Easy Cheesy Scalloped Potatoes 253 Ratings Vegan Scalloped Potatoes 12 Ratings Cheesy Scalloped Potatoes 30 Ratings Roasted Garlic Scalloped Potatoes 89 Ratings Old Irish Scalloped Potatoes 30 Ratings Scalloped Potatoes Without Cheese 624 Ratings Creamy and Crispy Scalloped Potatoes 101 Ratings Scalloped Potatoes III 17 Ratings Mormon Scalloped Potatoes 106 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.;Meanwhile, set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.;Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Carefully transfer potatoes to a deep 8-inch square baking dish.;Combine 1 1/2 cups Cheddar cheese, cream, garlic powder, pepper, and nutmeg in the pressure cooker with the remaining liquid; select Sauté function and cook until smooth and creamy, about 5 minutes.;Pour sauce evenly over potatoes and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese.;Broil in the preheated oven until cheese is golden, about 5 minutes.
